mnemonic: broadly [бро'дли] вообще - (Брод ли) нужен нам, или глубина, вообще не пойму;
examples: She knows broadly what to expect.
The store has a broad selection of coats.
We invest broadly to lessen the risk.
the broad outlines of a problem
The party has a broadly socialist orientation.
There was broad agreement on the new government.
She discusses “family” in its broadest sense.
Independent films are, broadly defined, movies that appeal to sophisticated audiences.
There are three broad categories of industry in the region: computers, finance, and education.
